channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5065] localhost:8181/hawtio/index.html not available (404)
item.description:
Any Hawtio page cannot be found.
It happens randomly. I've only seen this on slower VM environment. It has never happened on my laptop yet.

Couldn't it be possibly a new jetty-related issue? It has never happened with fuse 6.2.1.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I saw similar issue when testing LDAP on jenkins.
Scenario was

  • start fuse
  • deploy ldap login module (osgi:install -s mvn:group/artifact/version) - bundle with blueprint xml
  • try http POST to simulate login from hawtio. Test is written in java but post from this curl command should be the same 

    curl 'http://localhost:8181/hawtio/auth/login/' -X POST -H "Authorization: Basic `echo -n 'username:password' | base64`" -I

For valid username:password the response status code was 200 - as expected.
But for invalid username:password it randomly returned http 405 - method nod allowed or http 404 - not found.

Hi Martin Štěpánek If I run on our Jenkins Windows 2008 Server box, I'll only get one tab in the navigation bar at the top. i.e for Fabric I just see Containers, and in the root container I just get ActiveMQ. Is this what you're seeing, or is there something else?
That is Kevin Earls another reported issue. This one is just 404 error. Nothing is loaded. As if Jetty hasn't been started yet or something...

Martin Štěpánek Just to be certain, you're only talking about windows here. Does everything work correctly if you run on a RHEL or linux VM with those specifications?

BTW I can reproduce this on our Jenkins Windows 2008 server, which is not an openstack vm, but is on the slow side.

Kevin Earls yes, windows.
I haven't tried rhel.
I'm no longer able to reproduce this either on our Windows2008/IE Jenkins node or using Windows 10/Edge. I'm going to assume this also was fixed by ENTESB-5062

I have seen this again on my laptop with Fedora. I can't see anything suspicious in fuse.log. It just takes some time to start jetty or so. I have seen it when I run a test that starts Fuse and then runs Hawtio. The test continued working after one minute. It's only a faster version of slow VM problem where it can take 15 min or longer (if ever).
What has been done here that the issue is Resolved and Done? The issue seems to stay as it was.

The issue ocurres occasionally on my local Fedora. But the main occurrence is on win 10 and win 2012 VMs (on our lab machine) that are somewhat slower. Slow Openstack VMs has even much higher occurrence.

I haven't been able to reproduce this for a while, either on our Jenkins Windows Server 2008 box or on the Windows 2010 VM on my laptop. Martin Štěpánek the next time you see this can you please add as much information as possible, including:

1. Are you using hawtio embedded in Fuse or a standalone hawtio?
2. Does this only happen immediately after starting Fuse?
3. What do you need to do to recover? Just try again, restart your browser, or restart fuse?

Thanks

Hi Kevin Earls,

1. embedded
2. yes
3. restart Fuse

Martin Štěpánek I saw this on my desktop today, and I can't say for sure, but I think it may have been caused by a zombie process that was left behind from a previous fuse server instance. When you see this on slower VMs, are you stopping and restarting Fuse instances between tests or anything like that? Is it possible there might be old processes that did not shut down properly before you tried to start again?

If you see it again on Fedora can you do "ps -ef | grep -i java" to see what's running? Thanks.

are you stopping and restarting Fuse instances between tests or anything like that?

Yes, this is exactly the case when it happens.

On the other hand I have seen this occasionally when I had started Fuse manually. As far as I can remember it was enough to restart Fuse to fix it. I can't tell you whether I stopped another Fuse before starting the new one.

I'll focus on this occasion when it happens again.
Changing to blocker, because without any reason, hawtio application is sometimes gone.

Here's the exact race condition between:

"pool-9-thread-2@10221" prio=5 tid=0xb3 nid=NA runnable
 
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.DefaultWebAppDependencyManager$1.serviceChanged(DefaultWebAppDependencyManager.java:79)
 
	  - locked <0x27ee> (a org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.DefaultWebAppDependencyManager$1)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.DefaultWebAppDependencyManager$1.serviceChanged(DefaultWebAppDependencyManager.java:61)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.tracker.ReplaceableService.bind(ReplaceableService.java:71)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.tracker.ReplaceableService$Customizer.removedService(ReplaceableService.java:109)
 
	  at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker$Tracked.customizerRemoved(ServiceTracker.java:956)
 
	  at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker$Tracked.customizerRemoved(ServiceTracker.java:1)
 
	  at org.osgi.util.tracker.AbstractTracked.untrack(AbstractTracked.java:341)
 
	  at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker$Tracked.serviceChanged(ServiceTracker.java:902)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.invokeServiceListenerCallback(EventDispatcher.java:943)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.fireEventImmediately(EventDispatcher.java:794)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.fireServiceEvent(EventDispatcher.java:544)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.fireServiceEvent(Felix.java:4445)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.access$000(Felix.java:77)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix$1.serviceChanged(Felix.java:404)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.ServiceRegistry.unregisterService(ServiceRegistry.java:153)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.ServiceRegistrationImpl.unregister(ServiceRegistrationImpl.java:128)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.Activator.updateController(Activator.java:335)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.Activator$2.run(Activator.java:285)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
 
	  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

and:

"fabric-agent-175.0.2-deployer-5-thread-1@10866" prio=5 tid=0xca nid=NA runnable
 
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.DefaultWebAppDependencyManager.removeWebApp(DefaultWebAppDependencyManager.java:98)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.WebObserver$1.doDestroy(WebObserver.java:189)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.SimpleExtension.destroy(SimpleExtension.java:71)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender$2.run(AbstractExtender.java:306)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender.destroyExtension(AbstractExtender.java:332)
 
	  at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender.bundleChanged(AbstractExtender.java:190)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.invokeBundleListenerCallback(EventDispatcher.java:869)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.fireEventImmediately(EventDispatcher.java:790)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.fireBundleEvent(EventDispatcher.java:515)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.fireBundleEvent(Felix.java:4429)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.stopBundle(Felix.java:2528)
 
	  at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.stop(BundleImpl.java:1012)
 
	  at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent$BaseDeployCallback.stopBundle(Agent.java:487)
 
	  at io.fabric8.agent.service.Deployer$2.call(Deployer.java:893)
 
	  at io.fabric8.agent.service.Deployer$2.call(Deployer.java:888)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 
	  at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
 
	  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

pool-9-thread-2@10221 thread runs because FabricConfigAdminBridge updated org.ops4j.pax.web PID, so previous registration of org.osgi.service.http.HttpService is unregistered and org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.tracker.ReplaceableServiceListener#serviceChanged is called.

fabric-agent-175.0.2-deployer-5-thread-1@10866 in the meantime stops different bundles - among others web bundles and related extensions are removed and undeployed.

But when HttpService is unregistered, the mapping from previous and now-null HttpService to org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.model.WebApp is lost, so org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.DefaultWebAppDependencyManager#removeWebApp() fails with NPE:

16:13:18,750 | WARN  | {fabric-agent-175.0.2-deployer-5-thread-1} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.SimpleExtension] (SimpleExtension.java:73) | Error stopping extension for bundle io.hawt.hawtio-web [282]
 
java.lang.NullPointerException
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.DefaultWebAppDependencyManager.removeWebApp(DefaultWebAppDependencyManager.java:99)[276:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war:4.2.7]
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.WebObserver$1.doDestroy(WebObserver.java:189)[276:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war:4.2.7]
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.SimpleExtension.destroy(SimpleExtension.java:71)[276:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war:4.2.7]
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender$2.run(AbstractExtender.java:306)[276:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war:4.2.7]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)[:1.8.0_102]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)[:1.8.0_102]
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender.destroyExtension(AbstractExtender.java:332)[276:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war:4.2.7]
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender.bundleChanged(AbstractExtender.java:190)[276:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war:4.2.7]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.invokeBundleListenerCallback(EventDispatcher.java:869)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.fireEventImmediately(EventDispatcher.java:790)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.util.EventDispatcher.fireBundleEvent(EventDispatcher.java:515)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.fireBundleEvent(Felix.java:4429)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.stopBundle(Felix.java:2528)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleImpl.stop(BundleImpl.java:1012)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.4.1.jar:]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.service.Agent$BaseDeployCallback.stopBundle(Agent.java:487)[175:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.2.0.redhat-630167]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.service.Deployer$2.call(Deployer.java:893)[175:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.2.0.redhat-630167]
 
	at io.fabric8.agent.service.Deployer$2.call(Deployer.java:888)[175:io.fabric8.fabric-agent:1.2.0.redhat-630167]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)[:1.8.0_102]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)[:1.8.0_102]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)[:1.8.0_102]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_102]

After the above error we have:

JBossFuse:karaf@root> web:list
 
   ID   State         Web-State       Level  Web-ContextPath           Name
 
[ 282] [Active     ] [Failed     ]  [   80] [/hawtio                 ] hawtio :: hawtio-web (1.4.0.redhat-630167)
 
[ 284] [Active     ] [Deployed   ]  [   80] [/hawtio-karaf-terminal  ] hawtio :: Karaf terminal plugin (1.4.0.redhat-630167)
 
[ 290] [Active     ] [Deployed   ]  [   80] [/redhat-branding        ] hawtio :: Red Hat Fuse Branding (1.4.0.redhat-630167)
 
[ 305] [Active     ] [Failed     ]  [   80] [/redhat-branding        ] hawtio :: Red Hat AMQ Branding (1.4.0.redhat-630167)
 
[ 306] [Active     ] [Deployed   ]  [   80] [/hawtio-swagger         ] hawtio :: project (1.4.0.redhat-630167)

and HTTP requests to /hawtio url actually go to fabric-redirect bundle and eventually end with HTTP 404.

Even restarting hawtio-web bundle doesn't help:

16:18:01,071 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.WebEventDispatcher] (WebEventDispatcher.java:198) | Sending web event WebEvent [replay=false, type=DEPLOYING, bundle=io.hawt.hawtio-web [282], extenderBundle=org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war [276], cause=null, timestamp=1471616281071, contextPath=/hawtio, collisionIds=null, httpService=null, httpContext=null] for bundle io.hawt.hawtio-web
 
16:18:01,072 | DEBUG | {WebEventExecutor: 1} [?] (?:?) | org/osgi/service/web/DEPLOYING
 
16:18:01,078 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.parser.WebAppParser] (WebAppParser.java:175) | version found in web.xml - 2.4
 
16:18:01,079 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.parser.WebAppParser] (WebAppParser.java:115) | metadata-complete is: false
 
16:18:01,081 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.parser.WebAppParser] (WebAppParser.java:338) | scanning for ServletContainerInitializers
 
16:18:01,082 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.parser.WebAppParser] (WebAppParser.java:366) | found container initializers by SafeServiceLoader ... skip the old impl. 
16:18:01,291 | INFO  | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceFactoryImpl] (HttpServiceFactoryImpl.java:35) | Binding bundle: [io.hawt.hawtio-web [282]] to http service
 
16:18:01,292 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceStarted] (HttpServiceStarted.java:103) | Creating http service for: io.hawt.hawtio-web [282]
 
16:18:01,292 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceProxy] (HttpServiceProxy.java:47) | HttpServiceProxy created for HttpService org.ops4j.pax.web.service.internal.HttpServiceStarted@7f176ef1
 
16:18:01,295 | DEBUG | {Karaf Shell Console Thread} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.extender.AbstractExtender] (AbstractExtender.java:275) | Scheduling start of extension for bundle io.hawt.hawtio-web asynchronously
 
16:18:01,295 | DEBUG | {pool-10-thread-1} [org.ops4j.pax.web.extender.war.internal.WebEventDispatcher] (WebEventDispatcher.java:198) | Sending web event WebEvent [replay=false, type=WAITING, bundle=io.hawt.hawtio-web [282], extenderBundle=org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-extender-war [276], cause=null, timestamp=1471616281295, contextPath=/hawtio, collisionIds=[282, 282], httpService=null, httpContext=null] for bundle io.hawt.hawtio-web
 
16:18:01,310 | DEBUG | {WebEventExecutor: 1} [?] (?:?) | org/osgi/service/web/FAILED
See https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXWEB-1008

Even with the fix to PAXWEB-1008, there's still a non-zero chance that registration of new HttpService after org.ops4j.pax.web PID update will be faster than stopping of hawtio-web bundle.

This will be prevented by changing FabricConfigAdminBridge to finish update of org.ops4j.pax.web PID (synchronize on probable end of the update) before updating io.fabric8.agent PID. See: ENTESB-5995.

Fortunately this unregistration doesn't prevent registration of new /hawtio web context.
https://ops4j1.jira.com/browse/PAXWEB-1008 is resolved - we just need pax-web-4.2.8 release.
Karaf and Fabric8 upgraded to pax-web 4.2.8.

Resolved:

  • fabric8: https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8/commit/8e53952ecb9dd91db58e7b273b598bda196195be
  • karaf: https://github.com/jboss-fuse/karaf/commit/2935ee839e1aa89e91846e77d41107d9d8abe66f

6.3.0 175:

  • 0 tests failed due to 404 error so far
  • I can't reproduce it manually.

Closing the issue.
